channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Do some good in the world â€“ Perl developers required for a charity and giving-focused team in Kent, UK
item.description: Want to do something good for once? Join the Kickstarter of the charity world, supporting activists and causes around the world. Youâ€™ll be working in Perl to support a range of their highly successful charity and giving-focused projects.

item.title: Independent thinkers required! Mid/Senior-level Developer for an innovative London company
item.description: Have you ever worked for a company with a micromanagement style, where a boss was constantly breathing down your neck? Do you hate spending more time in meetings about product requirements than actually getting on with building the product?

item.title: Front-end focus for a full stack Perl developer
item.description: Perl developers are generally a multi-talented bunch who can segue smoothly between the nuts and bolts of back-end work and the immediately rewarding aesthetics of front-end work. If pushed, though, most could identify where their real passion lies along the spectrum from front-end to back-end.

item.title: PullRequest - Personal Milestone
item.description: Mohammad has got addicted to help others, via pull requests. He gives us some statistics on his journey so far.

item.title: Test2 Documentation Grant Progress Report
item.description: Alberto passes on an update from Chad, for his work on Test2, being done under a TPD grant.

item.title: Mohammad's report on LPW
item.description: Mohammad gave his first-ever Perl talk last year at LPW, and he came back to talk about Map::Tube this year.

item.title: The Lion and the Butterfly and the Camel
item.description: JJ's thoughts on the day, during which he gave a talk on using Perl 6 for teaching programming to complete novices.

item.title: Lance Wicks's report on LPW
item.description: Lance gave a tutorial on the Bailador web framework for Perl 6, and shares this thoughts on how that went, along with the rest of the day. I loved this line: "It was just so darn friendly, and the whole darn Perl community is so darn friendly".

item.title: London Perl Workshop is Amazing
item.description: It was great seeing Mark at LPW, throughly enjoying being an attendee, and that shines through in this post as well.

item.title: A unified and improved Supply concurrency model
item.description: Jonathan describes his recent work to improve the concurrency features provided by Supply.

item.title: 2017.47 More TPCiA Videos
item.description: The weekly roundup of Rakudo news, with links to a videos for Perl 6 talks from TPCiA.

item.title: Test All The Things
item.description: Jeff takes us through testing in Perl 6.

item.title: Perl5 as a first-class script engine in Java
item.description: An update from FlÃ¡vio on Perlito, an implementation of Perl 5 that runs in the JVM. You can now run Perl scripts from inside a Java application.

item.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: November 13th to 20th
item.description: The weekly round-up of P5P notes, which includes links to a lot of grant updates from Dave and Zefram.

item.title: Happy Taskgiving
item.description: Yanick has released some new commands for his tool for TaskWarrior.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: #331 - The London Perl Workshop
item.description:
The London Perl Workshop was on Saturday, and we've already had four blog posts about it. You'll pick up on a theme: it was a great community event.

There are a lot more TPCiA videos online now, and the Perl 6 weekly news has links to those about Perl 6.

Neil
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
